channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Nvidia, Groq and the limestone race to real-time AI: Why enterprises win or lose here
item.description: ​From miles away across the desert, the Great Pyramid looks like a perfect, smooth geometry — a sleek triangle pointing to the stars. Stand at the base, however, and the illusion of smoothness vanishes. You see massive, jagged blocks of limestone. It is not a slope; it is a staircase.​Remember this the next time you hear futurists talking about exponential growth.​Intel’s co-founder Gordon Moore (Moore's Law) is famously quoted for saying in 1965 that the transistor count on a microchip would double every year. Another Intel executive, David House, later revised this statement to “compute powe...

item.title: Amazon Echo, Google Nest, HomePod… quelles sont les meilleures enceintes connectées en 2026 ?
item.description: Vous avez décidé d'installer une ou plusieurs enceintes connectées chez vous ? Google Nest Mini, Amazon Echo, Apple HomePod… Il y a du choix ! On vous aide à y voir plus clair dans cette sélection des meilleures enceintes connectées avec assistant personnel.

item.title: India has 100M weekly active ChatGPT users, Sam Altman says
item.description: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman says India has the largest number of student users of ChatGPT worldwide.

item.title: Tesla CarPlay is coming but it's reportedly being held back by low iOS 26 adoption numbers
item.description: We're still waiting for Apple CarPlay compatibility for Tesla EVs, but it's been pushed back thanks to a slight hitch with iOS 26, according to Bloomberg's Mark Gurman. In the latest Power On newsletter, Gurman said that Tesla's plans to adopt CarPlay have been delayed due to app compatibility issues as well as low adoption rates for iOS 26. It's been a long wait for Tesla drivers who want CarPlay compatibility, especially since initial rumors indicated a late 2025 rollout and Bloomberg reported that Tesla was testing CarPlay in its vehicles in November. However, Gurman's latest newsletter rev...

item.title: You need to watch the intensely surreal cult classic Possession
item.description: Let me just say that I highly recommend you go into Possession blind. Don't watch a trailer. Don't even finish reading this. Go watch it now over on Shudder, Criterion, or Metrograph. It's also available through Kanopy or Hoopla if your library provides access. Then come back so we can talk about it in the […]

item.title: The enterprise AI land grab is on. Glean is building the layer beneath the interface.
item.description: In this week's episode of the Equity podcast, Glean CEO Arvind Jain explains the company's shift from enterprise search tool to middleware layer for enterprise AI.

item.title: Android Auto has quietly fixed a major Do Not Disturb issue that was frustrating passengers
item.description: Google has restored a key Android Auto setting that means driving status can be more accurately determined.

item.title: Microsoft has some bright ideas for keeping future data centers cool - but will they ever really come to fruition?
item.description: Microsoft explores high-temperature superconducting cables to reduce energy losses, improve data center efficiency, and allow more compact, sustainable power delivery.

item.title: Yamaha’s elite Dolby Atmos surround soundbar had a key weakness – and it made me freshly appreciate one of the more forgotten parts of the home theater experience
item.description: They may not seem the most important, but rear speakers can make or break an immersive setup, as I discovered after testing a Yamaha soundbar.
